learn.title: How VaakkuAI works
learn.subtitle: Everything you need to know about using the app and how usage is billed.
learn.tryWithoutSignupBody: You can try each tool a few times with no account: 3 Text-to-Speech tries, 2 Speech-to-Text tries, and 3 Translation tries. Sign up for full access, 1,000 free credits, history, and the option to use your own Sarvam API key.
learn.whatBody: VaakkuAI lets you use Sarvam AI's Indian-language models inside one app: convert text to speech, speech to text, and translate between English and Indian languages. You can use it in two ways—with your own Sarvam API key or with shared app credits.
learn.twoWaysTitle: Two ways to use the app
learn.option1Title: Option 1: Your own Sarvam API key (recommended)
learn.option1Body: You create a free account on Sarvam, get an API key, and paste it in VaakkuAI. All usage is then billed to your Sarvam account (they give new users ₹1000 free credits). Your key is stored encrypted and used only for your requests.
learn.step1: Sign up at the Sarvam Dashboard
learn.step2: Create an API key in the dashboard (API Keys section)
learn.step3: In VaakkuAI, go to Settings and paste your key
learn.option2Body: If you don't add a key, the app uses a shared API key and deducts from your in-app credit balance. You get 1000 credits when you sign up; each TTS, STT, or Translate call uses a small amount. When credits run out, add your own Sarvam key in Settings to keep using the app with your Sarvam account.
